content.rendered: Finding central London a bit baffling? Struggling to make your way through Oxford Street’s hordes of zealous shoppers? Don’t panic – help is at hand. Our Soho taxi driver’s guide will ably see you through even the largest crowds of meandering tourists, and have you enjoying some of the area’s more refined establishments in no time. For a lot of people, Soho is less an actual tangible area and more of a giant adult playground. The densely packed heart of London, where nothing and no-one ever slows down, let alone sleeps. But, of course, unlike Neverland, Soho is real. For a rough guide on its boundaries, draw a square between the four points at Oxford Circus, Piccadilly Circus, Leicester Square and Tottenham Court Rd tube stations. One square mile of endless bars, restaurants, clubs and shops. From the completely independent to the globally renowned. They can all be found in buzzy Soho. Packed in between these four corners is a world unto itself. The exciting, luminous, beating heart of London that pulsates with the vibrations of neon lights and swathes of giddy tourists. The Piccadilly Lights, Chinatown, The West End, Golden Square and even the famous Red Light District. Soho icons, every one. Obviously when it comes to things to do and – in particular – places to dine out or drink in, Soho’s cup runneth over. But that doesn’t necessarily make it any easier to find the right spot for you. Addison Lee have been serving this – and every – part of London since 1975. Delivering the same quality minicabs with the same promise for all those years. To ensure you’re journey is comfortable, prompt and above all safe no matter the time of day or year. Which is why we’ve put together this Soho taxi driver’s guide. To give you a few hints and tips on our favourite places to hang out while you’re here. Some you’ll have heard of, but some will surprise even the most seasoned of Soho regulars. So what are you waiting for? Book an Addison Lee now through our website or app and get exploring.
